page.title: 07ROSE GROWING CONTINUED
page.content: He needs to spray the roses to protect them from aphids and greenfly. The weather also, particularly too much rain and wind and severe frost, can damage the roses. Mr. Sutton sells roses all over England and Scotland. He uses lorries to transport them. He does not use rail transport because it is too slow. He owns two of his own lorries and uses local transport companies as well. The soil gets fed up of growing roses all the time and the plants are more prone to disease if they are grown in the same soil. Therefore he grows conifer trees in particular Golden Leylandi. This rests the soil from the rose plants. The best time of year for business is in September.
